intro: Telinaria horrida, commonly known as the roughleaf telinaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It is often found in open grasslands and along coastal areas. Telinaria horrida is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
